key_points: CNN anchor Jake Tapper agrees with the criticism of colleague Chris Cuomo's handling of news pertaining to his brother, Gov. Andrew Cuomo.
Chris Cuomo issued an on-air apology for his involvement in advising his brother during sexual harassment and covid-related scandals.
CNN had previously suspended its conflict-of-interest rules to allow Cuomo-on-Cuomo interviews during the early pandemic months.
Chris Cuomo advised Gov. Andrew Cuomo to fight back against sexual-harassment allegations, which was seen as a violation of journalism ethics.
CNN Worldwide President Jeff Zucker addressed the issue in a town hall meeting, demonstrating the network's commitment to accountability.
Tapper criticizes Chris Cuomo's actions as inappropriate and acknowledges his colleague's apology as extensive and genuine.
Tapper also speaks on his personal policy of not booking Republicans who promoted the falsehood that the presidential election was stolen.
Tapper emphasizes the importance of journalistic integrity and the responsibility to avoid spreading misinformation.
The controversy surrounding Chris Cuomo is seen as part of larger ethical concerns in television journalism.
Discussion also covers broader topics, such as the sincerity of cable-news hosts and the role of book tours in media transparency.
